TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MimeParameterWriter extends System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeFormatter
Public MustInherit Class MimeParameterWriter Inherits MimeFormatter

Docs.summary: Provides a common base implementation for writers of out-going request parameters for Web service clients implemented using HTTP but without SOAP.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter> and other classes in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols> namespace support the .NET Framework's implementations of Web services via the HTTP-GET and HTTP-POST operations. Web service writers and readers serialize and deserialize, respectively, between the parameters or return objects of Web methods and the HTTP request or response streams. Web service writers and readers use HTTP for transport but don't exchange messages using the SOAP standard.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter> class establishes a common request-writing format for client-side writing of Web method parameters into HTTP request streams.
You will typically not need to use <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter> or its descendant classes directly. Instead, when the Wsdl.exe tool generates client proxy code according to the HTTP-GET or HTTP-POST implementations, it applies the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute> to each Web method and sets the attribute's <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ParameterFormatter%2A> property to the appropriate type.

Docs.param: The HTTP request's original Uniform Resource Locator (URL).
The Web method parameter values to be added to the URL, if necessary.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, modifies the outgoing HTTP request's Uniform Request Locator (URL).
Docs.returns: A object that contains the modified, outgoing HTTP request's Uniform Request Locator (URL).

remarks.format: ## Remarks Of the classes derived from <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter>, only <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.UrlParameterWriter> modifies the HTTP request URL.

Docs.param: The out-going request, where the class allows transport protocols besides HTTP.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initializes the out-going HTTP request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Of the classes derived from <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter>, only <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter> implements the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter> method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the encoding used to write parameters to the HTTP request.
Docs.value: The encoding used to write parameters to the HTTP request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An encoding, as represented by the <xref:System.Text.Encoding> class, defines how to transform characters into a sequence of bytes.

.property instance bool UsesWriteRequest

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether Web method parameter values are serialized to the out-going HTTP request body.
Docs.value: if the Web method parameter values are serialized to the out-going HTTP request body; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter.UsesWriteRequest%2A> property determines whether the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter.WriteRequest%2A> method is invoked.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter> class's implementation of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter.UsesWriteRequest%2A> returns a value of `false`. The only derived class that overrides <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter.UsesWriteRequest%2A> is <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter>, whose implementation returns a value of `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void WriteRequest (System.IO.Stream requestStream, object[] values);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteRequest(class System.IO.Stream requestStream, object[] values) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub WriteRequest (requestStream As Stream, values As Object())
public: virtual void WriteRequest(System::IO::Stream ^ requestStream, cli::array <System::Object ^> ^ values);
abstract member WriteRequest : System.IO.Stream * obj[] -> unit override this.WriteRequest : System.IO.Stream * obj[] -> unit

Docs.param: An input stream for the outgoing HTTP request's body.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, serializes Web method parameter values into a stream representing the outgoing HTTP request body.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Of the classes derived from <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter>, only <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter> implements the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeParameterWriter.WriteRequest%2A> method.
